column4: applications -> add/remove   preferences button, make sure main restricted universe & multiverse are ticked and hit update
Gnome Partition Editor cannot be installed on your computer type (i386) o_O
it fetched a new version of gparted
what version of ubuntu are you running, first
i just downloaded the latest 10 mins ago
ok, put the contents of /etc/apt/sources.list on a pastebin   (in a terminal,   gedit /etc/apt/sources.list  will open it read-only)
will try very soon, i tried reinstalling ubuntu now
sure, it's an odd problem, I kinda looked forward to looking at it
i didn't say i solved it :)
boot the hard disk, then do that pastebin thingy
ok,  do sudo aptitude update && sudo aptitude install gparted ; if it fails, put up the complete error
you are the best, it worked! thank you so much
